Table of Contents

Class Container<T>

Namespace
osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

A drawable which can have children added to it. Transformations applied to a container are also applied to its children. Additionally, containers support various effects, such as masking, edge effect, padding, and automatic sizing depending on their children.

public class Container<T> : CompositeDrawable, IDependencyInjectionCandidate, IDisposable, IContainerEnumerable<T>, IContainerCollection<T>, IContainer, IDrawable, ITransformable, ICollection<T>, IReadOnlyList<T>, IReadOnlyCollection<T>, IEnumerable<T>, IEnumerable, ISourceGeneratedHandleInputCache, ISourceGeneratedLongRunningLoadCache, ISourceGeneratedDependencyActivator where T : Drawable

Constructors

Container()

Constructs a Container that stores children.

public Container()

Properties

AliveChildren

The publicly accessible list of alive children. Forwards to the alive children of Content. If Content is this container, then returns AliveInternalChildren.

public IReadOnlyList<T> AliveChildren { get; }

Property Value

IReadOnlyList<T>

AutoSizeAxes

Controls which Axes are automatically sized w.r.t. InternalChildren. Children's BypassAutoSizeAxes are ignored for automatic sizing. Most notably, RelativePositionAxes and RelativeSizeAxes of children do not affect automatic sizing to avoid circular size dependencies. It is not allowed to manually set Size (or Width / Height) on any Axes which are automatically sized.

public Axes AutoSizeAxes { get; set; }

Property Value

Axes

AutoSizeDuration

The duration which automatic sizing should take. If zero, then it is instantaneous. Otherwise, this is equivalent to applying an automatic size via a resize transform.

public float AutoSizeDuration { get; set; }

Property Value

float

AutoSizeEasing

The type of easing which should be used for smooth automatic sizing when AutoSizeDuration is non-zero.

public Easing AutoSizeEasing { get; set; }

Property Value

Easing

BorderColour

Determines the color of the border controlled by BorderThickness. Only has an effect when Masking is true.

public ColourInfo BorderColour { get; set; }

Property Value

ColourInfo

BorderThickness

Determines how thick of a border to draw around the inside of the masked region. Only has an effect when Masking is true. The border only is drawn on top of children using a sprite shader.

public float BorderThickness { get; set; }

Property Value

float

Remarks

Drawing borders is optimized heavily into our sprite shaders. As a consequence borders are only drawn correctly on top of quad-shaped children using our sprite shaders.

Child

Gets or sets the only child of this container.

public T Child { get; set; }

Property Value

T

Children

The publicly accessible list of children. Forwards to the children of Content. If Content is this container, then returns InternalChildren. Assigning to this property will dispose all existing children of this Container. If a foreach loop is used, iterate over the Container directly rather than its Children. 

public IReadOnlyList<T> Children { get; set; }

Property Value

IReadOnlyList<T>

ChildrenEnumerable

Sets all children of this container to the elements contained in the enumerable.

public IEnumerable<T> ChildrenEnumerable { set; }

Property Value

IEnumerable<T>

Content

The content of this container. Children and all methods that mutate Children (e.g. Add(T) and Remove(T, bool)) are forwarded to the content. By default a container's content is itself, in which case Children refers to InternalChildren. This property is useful for containers that require internal children that should not be exposed to the outside world, e.g. ScrollContainer<T>.

protected virtual Container<T> Content { get; }

Property Value

Container<T>

CornerExponent

Determines how gentle the curve of the corner straightens. A value of 2 results in circular arcs, a value of 2.5 (default) results in something closer to apple's "continuous corner". Values between 2 and 10 result in varying degrees of "continuousness", where larger values are smoother. Values between 1 and 2 result in a "flatter" appearance than round corners. Values between 0 and 1 result in a concave, round corner as opposed to a convex round corner, where a value of 0.5 is a circular concave arc. Only has an effect when Masking is true and CornerRadius is non-zero.

public float CornerExponent { get; set; }

Property Value

float

CornerRadius

Determines how large of a radius is masked away around the corners. Only has an effect when Masking is true.

public float CornerRadius { get; set; }

Property Value

float

Count

The amount of elements in Children.

public int Count { get; }

Property Value

int

EdgeEffect

Determines an edge effect of this Container. Edge effects are e.g. glow or a shadow. Only has an effect when Masking is true.

public EdgeEffectParameters EdgeEffect { get; set; }

Property Value

EdgeEffectParameters

ForceLocalVertexBatch

Whether to use a local vertex batch for rendering. If false, a parenting vertex batch will be used.

public bool ForceLocalVertexBatch { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

IsReadOnly

Whether this Container<T> can have elements added and removed. Always false.

public bool IsReadOnly { get; }

Property Value

bool

this[int]

Accesses the index-th child.

public T this[int index] { get; }

Parameters

index int

The index of the child to access.

Property Value

T

The index-th child.

Masking

If enabled, only the portion of children that falls within this Container's shape is drawn to the screen.

public bool Masking { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

MaskingSmoothness

Determines over how many pixels the alpha component smoothly fades out when an inner EdgeEffect or BorderThickness is present. Only has an effect when Masking is true.

public float MaskingSmoothness { get; set; }

Property Value

float

Padding

Shrinks the space children may occupy within this Container by the specified amount on each side.

public MarginPadding Padding { get; set; }

Property Value

MarginPadding

RelativeChildOffset

The offset of the relative position/size coordinate space of children of this Container. Children positioned at this offset will appear as if they were positioned at Position = osuTK.Vector2.Zero in this Container.

public Vector2 RelativeChildOffset { get; set; }

Property Value

Vector2

RelativeChildSize

The size of the relative position/size coordinate space of children of this Container. Children positioned at this size will appear as if they were positioned at Position = osuTK.Vector2.One in this Container.

public Vector2 RelativeChildSize { get; set; }

Property Value

Vector2

Methods

Add(T)

Adds a child to this container. This amounts to adding a child to Content's Children, recursing until Content == this.

public virtual void Add(T drawable)

Parameters

drawable T

protected override void AddInternal(Drawable drawable)

AddRange(IEnumerable<T>)

Adds a range of children. This is equivalent to calling Add(T) on each element of the range in order.
